name: Faithful remnant (gathered, healed)
blurb: God assembles the lame and banished; remnant becomes both dew of blessing and lion of judgment.

name: Nations who gloat over Zion
blurb: Coalition of mockers to be shamed; they will lick dust like serpents and fear the LORD.

name: Triadic ‘Hear’ oracles
blurb: Summons structure organizes the book’s flow from summons to sentence to solution.

name: YHWH the Witness-Judge
blurb: God summons creation to hear the covenant case; plaintiff and judge in one.

name: Assyria (invader)
blurb: Primary geopolitical threat in Micah’s horizon; foil for messianic peace.

name: Balak and Balaam
blurb: Narrative of attempted cursing turned to blessing; remember to know the LORD’s righteous acts.
searchText: balak and balaam group allusion narrative of attempted cursing turned to blessing; remember to know the lord’s righteous acts.

name: Children stripped of glory forever
blurb: Intergenerational theft—future clipped by present greed.

name: Contemporaries: Isaiah, Hosea, Amos
blurb: Micah overlaps with other 8th-century prophets; themes echo and spar with Isaiah 2, Hos 4, Am 5.

name: Devisers of iniquity at morning’s light

name: Egypt & Assyria restored pathways
blurb: Future highway imagery—diaspora gathered from rival powers.

name: Evicting women from pleasant houses
blurb: Mothers displaced; domestic security shattered by elites.

name: Gathering the lame and the banished
blurb: God’s preferential option for the broken—kingdom composed of healed exiles.

name: Heads of Jacob / rulers of Israel
blurb: Cannibal rulers who flay and boil the people—grotesque metaphor for predatory governance.

name: Judges who sell justice
blurb: Verdicts priced; courts become marketplaces—law as luxury good.

name: Many nations come to Zion
blurb: International pilgrimage for Torah instruction—mission by attraction.

name: Merchants with false scales and weights
blurb: Economic fraud sacralized—bags of deceit, stones that cheat.

name: Moses, Aaron, Miriam (Exodus leaders)
blurb: Exodus credentials ground the lawsuit—past grace magnifies present guilt.

name: Priests who teach for a price
blurb: Instruction monetized; sacred vocation becomes side-hustle.

name: Prophets who cry ‘Peace’ when fed
blurb: Stomachs steer sermons; oracles become meal tickets.

name: Seven shepherds and eight leaders
blurb: Enigmatic fullness of leadership raised against Assyria—symbolic abundance of protection.

name: Statutes of Omri and works of the house of Ahab
blurb: Northern dynasty paradigms of apostasy imported into Judah; policy becomes idolatry.

name: Violence in the houses of the rich
blurb: Palatial neighborhoods built on blood and lies.

name: Ahaz of Judah
blurb: Crisis reign marked by Syro-Ephraimite war and Assyrian entanglements; religious compromise proliferates.

name: Hezekiah of Judah
blurb: Reformer king during Assyrian pressure; Micah’s critique shapes later repentance (cf. Jer 26:18).
searchText: hezekiah of judah person king reformer king during assyrian pressure; micah’s critique shapes later repentance (cf. jer 26:18).

name: Jotham of Judah
blurb: First of the kings in Micah’s superscription; period of relative stability before Ahaz.

name: Micah filled with power, justice, might
blurb: True prophet stands in the Spirit to name sin without price tag.

name: Micah of Moresheth
blurb: Rural prophet from Moresheth-Gath, speaking bluntly against urban corruption in Samaria and Jerusalem.

name: Achzib (Deception)

name: Adullam
blurb: Refuge of David now becomes repository of Judah’s glory—exile imagery revived.

name: Arise and thresh, daughter Zion
blurb: Horns of iron, hoofs of bronze—sanctified strength to devote spoil to the LORD.

name: Babylon (named exile)
blurb: City of captivity and stage of promised rescue—intermediate chastening in salvation history.

name: Beth-ezel (House of Support)
blurb: Neighbor’s support withdrawn; the house of ‘support’ offers none in crisis.

name: Build Zion with blood
blurb: Urban splendor erected on violence; architecture as indictment.

name: Cannibal metaphor for rulers

name: Cut down your pillars
blurb: Cultic steles toppled—memory of false gods erased.

name: Cut off carved images
blurb: Tangible idols removed—art re-purposed to truth.

name: Cut off sorceries
blurb: Manipulative spirituality ended; no spellcraft in Zion.
